findings.title: TPL-16:Centralized Risk With Coin Transfer in lendingPool::claimAidrop
findings.description: The lendingPool contract's claimERC721Airdrop, claimERC20Airdrop, and claimERC1155Airdrop functions can directly call claim airdrop in the corresponding contract to transfer funds to the TO address. However, only privileged accounts (onlyLendingPoolConfigurator) can call these functions, which poses a strong centralized risk.

findings.title: TPL-10: weird ERC20 tokens will result in liquidity issues and protocol insolvency
findings.description: The protocol addresses incorrect compliance of return values by using SafeERC20 but balance checks are not included in cases of fee-on-transfer or rebasing tokens are used, which can cause liquidity issues and protocol insolvency.
